icontrol.drivers.instruments

Class iC_Instrument

  • java.lang.Object
    • icontrol.drivers.Device
      • icontrol.drivers.instruments.iC_Instrument

  • @iC_Annotation(CommPorts=none,
               InstrumentClassName="iC-control")
public class iC_Instrument
extends Device
    A virtual Instrument without Communication that provides mostly control functions for processing the script and the program itself.

    Scriptable Instrument-Commands:

    • DisplayStatusMessage(String)
    • #ExecuteShellCommand(String)
    • MonitorChart(float, String, String, String, String, String, String, String)
    • Pause()
    • Wait(float)
    • WaitDate(String)
    • WaitForStop()
    • WaitForUser(String)
    • getFreeMemory()

    • Nested Class Summary

        Device.CommPorts, Device.GenericInstrument, Device.GPIBcontroller

    • Method Detail

      • Pause

        @AutoGUIAnnotation(DescriptionForUser="Pause Scripting until button \'Continue\' is pressed.",
                   ParameterNames={})
public void Pause()
        Puts the processing of the script into pause mode. To un-pause, the user must press the "Continue" button in the GUI

      • Wait

        @AutoGUIAnnotation(DescriptionForUser="Pause Scripting for specified amount of time.",
                   ParameterNames="Wait time [sec]",
                   DefaultValues="5")
public void Wait(float WaitTimeInSeconds)
        Interrupts processing of the script by a certain amount of time. Because it uses Thread.sleep the sleep method might get interrupted by some other thread (which I don't think should occur) in which case the actual time spend waiting might be shorter.

      • WaitForUser

        @AutoGUIAnnotation(DescriptionForUser="<html>Wait until the User presses the OK button in a popup window.\nBackground processes will continue meanwhile.</html>",
                   ParameterNames="Additional Message",
                   DefaultValues="Waiting ...")
public void WaitForUser(java.lang.String Message)
        Interrupts processing of the script in a way that allows background processes (for instance MonitorChart) to continue. This method displays a modeless dialog to the user which includes the additional message.
        Parameters:
        Message - The additional message displayed to the user

      • StopOrGo

        @AutoGUIAnnotation(DescriptionForUser="<html>Ask user to Stop or Continue processing the script\nBackground processes will continue meanwhile.</html>",
                   ParameterNames="Additional Message",
                   DefaultValues="Waiting ...")
public void StopOrGo(java.lang.String Message)
        Interrupts processing of the script in a way that allows background processes (for instance MonitorChart) to continue. This method displays a modeless dialog to the user which includes the additional message. When the user selects 'Stop' then processing of the script is stopped, and when the user selects 'Continue' processing of the script is continued.
        Parameters:
        Message - The additional message displayed to the user

      • WaitDate

        @AutoGUIAnnotation(DescriptionForUser="<html>Wait until the specified date and time before continuing. \nBackground processes will continue meanwhile.</html>",
                   ParameterNames="Date and Time",
                   DefaultValues="23.11 17:35",
                   ToolTips="Format: MM.dd HH:mm (24-h notation)")
 @iC_Annotation(MethodChecksSyntax=true)
public void WaitDate(java.lang.String DateAndTime)
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             throws java.util.zip.DataFormatException
        Interrupts processing of the script until the specified date and time in a way that allows background processes (for instance MonitorChart) to continue. During Syntax-Check mode, the date and time is echoed on the Status Area of the GUI.
        Parameters:
        DateAndTime - The date and time after which processing of the script will be continued.
        Throws:
        java.util.zip.DataFormatException - when the Syntax check fails

      • WaitForStop

        @AutoGUIAnnotation(DescriptionForUser="Wait until the User presses Stop.",
                   ParameterNames={})
public void WaitForStop()
        Waits until the user presses Stop in the GUI. Bckground processes continue to work.

      • MonitorChart

        @iC_Annotation(MethodChecksSyntax=true)
 @AutoGUIAnnotation(DescriptionForUser="<html>Monitors up to 5 variables returned from execupting the passed Command Lines.</html>",
                   ParameterNames={"Time Intervall [sec]","Y axis label","File Extension","Command Line 1","Command Line 2","Command Line 3","Command Line 4","Command Line 5"},
                   DefaultValues={"1","Temperature [K]",".monT","\"\"","\"\"","\"\"","\"\"","\"\""},
                   ToolTips={"Time between two measurements.","If the FileExtension does not contain a \'.\' a \'.\' is automatically added.","The Command Line must be enclosed in double quotes (\")","The Command Line must be enclosed in double quotes (\")","The Command Line must be enclosed in double quotes (\")","The Command Line must be enclosed in double quotes (\")","The Command Line must be enclosed in double quotes (\")"})
public void MonitorChart(float TimeIntervall,
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              java.lang.String YLabel,
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              java.lang.String FileExtension,
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              java.lang.String CommandLine1,
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              java.lang.String CommandLine2,
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              java.lang.String CommandLine3,
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              java.lang.String CommandLine4,
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              java.lang.String CommandLine5)
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                       throws javax.script.ScriptException
        Starts a new thread that executes the passed Command Lines at the given time interval, and displays the returned value in an XY-chart. A separate XY Series is used for the different Command Lines. The values are stored in a file together with the number of seconds elapsed since processing of the script started. The chart is saved as a .png file at the end.

        Note: JFreeChart was not designed for speed, and it occurs frequently, that events to refresh the chart get queued, which slows down the response. There is no simple way to prevent queuing, and to find a work around is on the to do list.

        This methods performs a syntax check.

        Parameters:
        TimeIntervall - The temperature is monitored every TimeInterval-seconds.
        YLabel - The label for the Y-axis
        FileExtension - is appended to the FileName used to store the monitored temperatures. If it contains no '.' a '.' is automatically inserted. If the filename already exists, a new file with a counter is inserted between the FileName and the FileExtension.
        CommandLine1 - A String containing the command line that is passed to Device.DispatchCommand to obtain the desired value to be displayed in the chart.
        CommandLine2 - same as CommandLine1
        CommandLine3 - same as CommandLine1
        CommandLine4 - same as CommandLine1
        CommandLine5 - same as CommandLine1
        Throws:
        javax.script.ScriptException - when executing the Command Line failed (bubbles up from Device.DispatchCommand or from getDouble).

      • DisplayStatusMessage

        @AutoGUIAnnotation(DescriptionForUser="<html>Displays a Status Message in the GUI.</html>",
                   ParameterNames="Message",
                   DefaultValues="...")
public void DisplayStatusMessage(java.lang.String Message)
        This method displays Message in the Status Text Area of the GUI. It's mainly used during development and testing.
        Parameters:
        Message - The String to be shown in the Status Area of the GUI

      • getFreeMemory

        public long getFreeMemory()
        Returns:
        The the free memory in kByte that is available for this application on the heap.

      • ExecuteShellCommand

        @AutoGUIAnnotation(DescriptionForUser="<html>Executes a command in the operating system.<br>iC waits until the command has finished before scripting continues.<br>The working directory for the command is set to the Project Directory.<br>No shell/command window is opened, so commands such as \"ls\" (Mac) or <br>\"dir\" (Win) can be executed.</html>",
                   ParameterNames={"Command","Argument1","Argument2","Argumant3"},
                   DefaultValues={"dir",">test.txt"})
public void ExecuteShellCommand(java.lang.String Command,
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         java.lang.String Argument1,
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         java.lang.String Argument2,
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         java.lang.String Argument3)
        Executes a command in the operating system. Opens a shell (Mac) respectively a Command Window (Win) to exectue the command. The method waits until the command has finished before continuing scripting in iC. The output of the command is shown in the Status Text.
        Parameters:
        Command - The command to be executed in the operating system
